intro: Callisthene mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Callisthene mucronata is often found in coastal and mountainous regions where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
